intro: Geranium acrocarphum, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Geranium acrocarphum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
